title: Introduction To Buddhism
comment: An introduction to the three most important things in the Buddhist religion.

title: Seven Stage in the Path to Purity

title: Four Noble Truths
comment: At the Center For Spiritual Living, Granada Hills, CA

title: Five Kinds of Buddhist Practitioners
comment: From the Dhammavihari Sutta on five types of Buddhist, only one of whom can be said to "dwell in the dhamma".

title: In Line With the Teaching
comment: On practicing in line with the Buddha's teaching without having to have studied all of the Tipitaka.

title: The Four Iddhipada or Paths to Power

title: Overview of the Buddhist Theory of Karma
comment: On the 14 types of karmic retribution, the 12 types of karma, and the threefold karmic wheel.

title: Stories on the Goals of Mindfulness
comment: Some examples of how mindfulness is able to acheive its goals.

title: The Buddha's Order of Teaching
comment: On the Anupubbikatha, a method of teaching often imployed by the Buddha, in which he would start with speech on basic goodness and end with talk on total freedom.

title: Wanting and Buddhism
comment: On desire for progress and enlightenment and how one should properly approach the path to Enlightenment.

title: Life's Blessings IV
comment: care for mother and father, good relationship with relatives, straight and blameless work, charity and righteous conduct

title: Life's Blessings III
comment: much knowledge, skill, well-trained discipline, words well-spoken

title: Life's Blessings I
comment: Introduction, non-association with fools, association with the wise, homage to those worthy

title: Life's Blessings V
comment: abstaining, refraining from evil, giving up intoxicants, heedfulness of reality

title: Life's Blessings II
comment: a suitable dwelling, having done good, setting oneself right

title: Life's Blessings VI
comment: Respect, humility, contentment, gratitude, listening to Dhamma from time to time
